item.title: Far right hanging flags along all of Sevenoaks way, 4th September
item.description:
Flags tied to almost all lamposts. These are part of a campaign of intimidation rolled out across the country against those awaiting processing is based on racist anti-immigration ideology and should be treated as a hate crime and dealt with urgently. The longer they stay there then the more empowered this people will be. They are no different from the National Front of old. Get rid of them asap else many people will stop shopping around Nugent or the units along here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springvale Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin overflow fly tipping, 4th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farnaby Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Fly tipping winslade house, 4th September
item.description:

item.title: Flooding, 4th September
item.description:
With every heavy down pour, the road floods. Dependent upon the length of the downpour, the road will remain flooded for hours. The flooding has on occasion encompassed both sides of the road. Opposite Happi Feet nursery. The issue has been ongoing for over 5 years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging bushes, 4th September
item.description:
Near the parking machine in Methuan Road, Bexleyheath there are numerous prickly bushes overhanging the pavement which need to be cut right back. They have spikes on their branches which could scrath people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Methuen Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Staplehurst door broken, 4th September

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southmere Drive, London

item.title: Unlicensed scaffolding, road obstruction., 4th September
item.description:
Unlicensed scaffolding, scaffolders not wearing helmets, illegally obstructing the road with vehicles. They started immediately threatening me as I enquired why they don't have a license and are working without helmets.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Formosa Street, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin removed and litter strewn as no alternative provision, 4th September
item.description:
The solar powered giant compacting litter bin has recently been removed from the bus stop and not replaced. This is a busy bus stop serving students from the nearby college… without a bin, litter is discarded onto the ground to blow about. Is there intention to replace the bin asap? If not, there needs to be please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Common, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree fence almost falling, 4th September
item.description:
The ring fence around this tree is almost falling. If not fixed quickly enough, it will fall into the pavement, breaking the tree trunk and blocking the pavement for pedestrians.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rendlesham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Red graffiti on road markings, 4th September
item.description:
Red graffiti of St George’s Crosses has been spray painted onto roundabout road markings here and on other roundabouts along Westcombe Park Road. It appeared this week. I am worried this could be visually distracting or a hazard to drivers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 386, Westcombe Park Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is affecting telephone line attached to my property, 4th September
item.description:
Telephone line has to go through the tree outside my property and during winds, line is moving and is attached to my property causing noise and potentially damage to my property. I want to avoid a potential claim should this happen. There is also an issue where birds are extensively soiling from the trees which is causing dirt/damage to paintwork on cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadcroft Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
